tidbits.title: Bamiyan Buddhas
tidbits.description: Afghanistan was home to two colossal Buddha statues carved into a cliff in Bamiyan. Sadly, they were destroyed by the Taliban in 2001, but their remnants remain culturally significant.

tidbits.title: Silk Road Connection
tidbits.description: A crucial part of the ancient Silk Road, Afghanistan has a rich history of trade and cultural exchange between East and West.

tidbits.title: Bunkers
tidbits.description: Albania has around 173,000 bunkers scattered across the country, remnants of its communist past under Enver Hoxha.

tidbits.title: Religious Harmony
tidbits.description: Albania embraces religious tolerance, with Islam, Christianity, and other faiths coexisting peacefully.

tidbits.title: Sahara Desert
tidbits.description: A significant part of the Sahara Desert lies within Algeria's borders, showcasing stunning sand dunes and unique desert landscapes.

tidbits.title: Rich History
tidbits.description: Algeria has been inhabited for thousands of years, with historical sites like the ancient Roman city of Timgad and the Casbah of Algiers showcasing its diverse history.

tidbits.title: Culture of Fa'a Samoa
tidbits.description: American Samoa embraces the Fa'a Samoa, a way of life deeply rooted in Samoan culture, emphasizing respect for elders, communal living, and traditional dance (Siva).

tidbits.title: Football Passion
tidbits.description: American Samoa gained attention for its national football team's (soccer) resilience, famously recording one of the most significant victories after a long losing streak.

tidbits.title: Tax Haven
tidbits.description: Andorra has historically been a tax haven, attracting shoppers for duty-free shopping and tourists for its ski resorts and natural beauty.

tidbits.title: No Army
tidbits.description: Andorra is one of the few countries in the world without a standing army, relying on its neighbors, France and Spain, for defense.
